MAST.utility.inputoptions module¶

class MAST.utility.inputoptions.InputOptions[source]¶

Stores options information in dictionary format for retrieval Dictionary is organised as sections and key, value pairs

within a section
Attributes:
options <dict of sections which is a dict of key/values>:
stores options which consist of sections and key/values under the sections
e.g.: section mast, keyword ‘program’
inputoptions.options[‘mast’][‘program’] = ‘vasp’
get_item(section, key=None, default_value=None)[source]¶

Returns the value of the key under this section

get_section_keys(section)[source]¶

Return the available keys under a section.

get_sections()[source]¶

Return the available sections in the input options.

print_fourthlevel_dict(initheader2, thirddict)[source]¶

Print a third-level dictionary.

initheader2 <str>: prepending header thirddict <dict>: dictionary that was key2’s value

print_python_section(secname)[source]¶

Print python commands that will recreate the InputOptions section when the commands are run in python.

secname <str>: section name

print_secondlevel_dict(initheader1, seconddict)[source]¶

Print a second-level dictionary.

initheader1 <str>: prepending header seconddict <dict>: dictionary that was key1’s value

print_thirdlevel_dict(initheader2, thirddict)[source]¶

Print a third-level dictionary.

initheader2 <str>: prepending header thirddict <dict>: dictionary that was key2’s value

reset()[source]¶

Option to reset the dict values

set_item(section, key, value)[source]¶

Adds the key/value dict item into the option under the respective section.

NO CHANGE if the key was already in the section.
update_item(section, key, value)[source]¶

Updates the key/value dict item in the option.
